rows.title: Day One: Module Reminder

text.eng: Good day! This is a reminder that the first MaPa Chat module will start [SET TIME] later. I'm excited to start the program with you! We'll start building a Happy Home with a simple yet effective tip: doing One-on-One Time. You will see what it can do for your family! Let's meet!

guidance.eng: Replace [SET Time] with your session time before sending the message.

rows.title: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

title.eng: After the Session: Thanking Participants and Reminding Them to Practise

text.eng: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.text: Hello! Thank you for attending our session! Remember, our main activity this week is One-on-One Time with your child. Even just 5 minutes can go a long way! You can do this!

rows.title: Day Three: Support Reminder

text.eng: Hi! How is your practice of the homework assignment going? I understand that you may have some challenges with this module. Feel free to text me if you have any questions.Thank you!

rows.text: Hi! How is your practice of the homework assignment going? I understand that you may have some challenges with this module. Feel free to text me if you have any questions.Thank you!

rows.title:
One Day Before the Next Online Session: Reminder for
the Next Session

title.eng:
One Day Before the Next Online Session: Reminder for
the Next Session

text.eng:
Good morning! We've reached the end of the week.
How is One-on-One Time with your children?
Share your successes and challenges! Feel free to be creative in sharing: send stories, voice messages, or pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was at our next session on [INSERT DATE HERE].

guidance.eng: Insert the date for the next session before sending the message

rows.title: Day One: Module Reminder

text.eng: It's  been  a  whole  week!  Our  next  chat  session  is  [SET  TIME]  later.  We'll  talk  about  the  benefits  of  talking  about  feelings  with  your  child—and  add  a  second  foundation  to  the  walls  of  our  Happy  Home.  Let's  chat!

guidance.eng: Replace [SET Time] with your session time, then send the message along with this image

rows.text: It's  been  a  whole  week!  Our  next  chat  session  is  [SET  TIME]  later.  We'll  talk  about  the  benefits  of  talking  about  feelings  with  your  child—and  add  a  second  foundation  to  the  walls  of  our  Happy  Home.  Let's  chat!

rows.title: Message 1: Greetings

text.eng: Greetings  and  Greetings! Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today

guidance.eng: Give parents a moment to share how they feel. Also, share your own feelings. For example, “I’m happy to be part of our MaPaChat session today

rows.text: Greetings  and  Greetings! Welcome  to  Module  2  of  our  MaPaChat!  How  are  you  all?  Are  you  happy? Stressed?  Angry?  Annoyed?  Calm?  Whatever  emotion  you  are  feeling...it's  okay!  Let's  type  what  we're  feeling today
rows.guidance: Give parents a moment to share how they feel. Also, share your own feelings. For example, “I’m happy to be part of our MaPaChat session today

rows.title: Message 2: Discussion about Home Activity

text.eng: Last week,  we  talked  about  One-on-One  Time. with  the  child.  Today,  we  will  look  at  one  of  the  other  ways  of using  One-on-One  Time—talking  about  feelings with  the  child.  But  first,  let's  chat  about  your  home  activities or  homework.  How  is  your  One-on-One  Time  going?

guidance.eng: Accept the experience that parents will share.

rows.text: Last week,  we  talked  about  One-on-One  Time. with  the  child.  Today,  we  will  look  at  one  of  the  other  ways  of using  One-on-One  Time—talking  about  feelings with  the  child.  But  first,  let's  chat  about  your  home  activities or  homework.  How  is  your  One-on-One  Time  going?
rows.guidance: Accept the experience that parents will share.

rows.title: Message 3: Sharing Success

text.eng: One  of  the  successes  you  shared  last  week. You  did  One-on-One  Time  and  [describe  the  success]. You  did  a  great  job  [attributing  success  to building block].

guidance.eng: Share a success from what the parents have shared.

rows.text: One  of  the  successes  you  shared  last  week. You  did  One-on-One  Time  and  [describe  the  success]. You  did  a  great  job  [attributing  success  to building block].
rows.guidance: Share a success from what the parents have shared.

rows.title: Message 4: Discuss Challenge

text.eng: Now  we  will  discuss  a  shared  challenge  about  [describe  the  challenge  from  the  feedback  module].

guidance.eng: If no one shared a challenge last week, send the example challenges one by one from the pdf.

rows.text: Now  we  will  discuss  a  shared  challenge  about  [describe  the  challenge  from  the  feedback  module].
rows.guidance: If no one shared a challenge last week, send the example challenges one by one from the pdf.

rows.title: Message 5: Discussion about challenge & solution

text.eng: Can  we  work  together  to  come  up  with  a  positive  solution  to  [describe  the  challenge]?  What  might  a  parent  in  that  situation  do?

guidance.eng: Encourage parents to think of positive solutions. You will find some examples of challenges and solutions in the pdf.

rows.text: Can  we  work  together  to  come  up  with  a  positive  solution  to  [describe  the  challenge]?  What  might  a  parent  in  that  situation  do?
rows.guidance: Encourage parents to think of positive solutions. You will find some examples of challenges and solutions in the pdf.

rows.title: Message 6

text.eng: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family—like  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.text: Thank  you  so  much  for  your  ideas.  Now  that  you  know  how  to  use  One-on-One  Time  with  your  child,  you  can  also  try  it  with  other  members  of  your  family—like  your  spouse,  parents,  in-laws,  or  even  grandchildren!

rows.title: Message 7: Introducing MaPa Skill

text.eng:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.text:
Today  we're  going  to  talk  about  MaPa  Skill:  helping  children  manage  their  emotions.  Here  are  five  foundations  for  talking  to  children  about  emotions. 
1.  BREATHE  -  Breathe  before  you  start  to  calm  yourself  down. 
2.  SHARE  -  Share  your  feelings. 
3.  LISTEN  -  Listen  to  your  child  or  teenager. 
4.  PAINFUL  -  Concerned  for  them. 
5.  FIND  -  Find  the  positive

rows.title: Message 8: Comic about young child

text.eng: Here is a comic showing how a child talked about their feelings with their grandmother during One-on-One Time.

rows.text: Here is a comic showing how a child talked about their feelings with their grandmother during One-on-One Time.

rows.title: Messgae 9: Discussion about the Comic

text.eng: How  did  you  see  any  of  the  five  foundations  of  Talking  About  Feelings  in  this  comic?

guidance.eng: Give parents time to answer before moving on to the comic

rows.text: How  did  you  see  any  of  the  five  foundations  of  Talking  About  Feelings  in  this  comic?

rows.title: Message 10: Comic about a Teenage Child: Talking about Feelings

title.eng: Message 10: Comic about a Teenage Child: Talking about Feelings

text.eng: Here's another comic where Dad Jose talks about difficult emotions with his teenage son, Pablo

rows.text: Here's another comic where Dad Jose talks about difficult emotions with his teenage son, Pablo

rows.title: Message 11: Discussion about Comics

text.eng:
Let's also chat about this comic. What did you notice about how Tatay Jose spoke to his son?
Which of the foundations did you see?

guidance.eng: Give parents a chance to answer the first question before moving onto the next question

rows.text:
Let's also chat about this comic. What did you notice about how Tatay Jose spoke to his son?
Which of the foundations did you see?
rows.guidance: Give parents a chance to answer the first question before moving onto the next question

rows.title: Message 12: Discussion about Comics: Think about the Age of the Child

title.eng: Message 12: Discussion about Comics: Think about the Age of the Child

text.eng:
How would the story in the comic change if Dad was talking about his feelings to a young child
instead of a teenager?

guidance.eng: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.text:
How would the story in the comic change if Dad was talking about his feelings to a young child
instead of a teenager?
rows.guidance: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.title: Message 13: Discussion about Reasons for Talking About Feelings

title.eng: Message 13: Discussion about Reasons for Talking About Feelings

text.eng: Why is it helpful to encourage a young child or teenager to share their feelings?

guidance.eng: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.text: Why is it helpful to encourage a young child or teenager to share their feelings?
rows.guidance: Give parents opportunity to share their ideas

rows.title: Message 14: Setting a Home Activity

text.eng:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.text:
Thank you for sharing your ideas. For this week's homework, practice talking about feelings with your child during your One-on-One time and at other times.
Also try to pay attention to your own feelings as your day goes by.

rows.title: Message 15: Clarification

text.eng: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?

guidance.eng: Allow a few minutes for parents to ask questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before you give your own answer, give the group a chance to think about it and respond by saying "That's a good question! What do others think could be an answer or solution to that?"

rows.text: Do you have any more questions about talking about feelings?
rows.guidance: Allow a few minutes for parents to ask questions. Remember to thank parents for their questions. Before you give your own answer, give the group a chance to think about it and respond by saying "That's a good question! What do others think could be an answer or solution to that?"

rows.title: Message 16 –Video: MaPa Skill Reminder

text.eng: Here is a short video on how to talk about feelings with your child. It is a reminder of the foundations:

rows.text: Here is a short video on how to talk about feelings with your child. It is a reminder of the foundations:

rows.title: Message 17 – Video: Pause for a Moment

title.eng: Message 17 – Video: Pause for a Moment

text.eng:
Before we end today's chat session, we will do a Pause for a Moment.
Remember that you can also do this if you feel like it.
stress.

rows.text:
Before we end today's chat session, we will do a Pause for a Moment.
Remember that you can also do this if you feel like it.
stress.

rows.title: Message 18 – Gratitude

text.eng: Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.text: Thank you. What you did today was difficult but also very important. It will help you manage your stress and give your child the skills to manage their stress. Have a great day!

rows.title: Day Three: Reminder to Practise

text.eng:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn’t easy at first– especially if it’s new to you and your child– so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.text:
Hello! Remember that the main activity for this week is to talk about feelings in your One-on-One time and at
other times. Talking about
feelings isn’t easy at first– especially if it’s new to you and your child– so remember to practice.
Good job on your attempt!

rows.title: Day Five: Feedback

text.eng:
Hi! Could you share something positive that happened when you talked to your child about feelings?
Have you experienced any challenges while trying to do this? Could be creative!
Send stories, voice messages, and pictures. I'd love to hear how your week was when we
meet again on [INSERT DATE HERE].

guidance.eng: Accept submissions by parents for giving thumbs up, emoji, or compliments. Be sure to pick up one or two successes and challenges that can be discussed at the beginning of the next module.
